column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=4 .
#Text=Conclusions
#Text=In this study , we successfully developed an algorithm to estimate the leaf angle with LiDAR-derived point cloud data .
#Text=The study focused on an efficient solution for leaf segmentation and estimation of the leaf angle .
#Text=A leaf segmentation method based on k -means coupled with an octree structure was proposed .

#Text=In addition , the issue of possible segmentation errors , which has been omitted in the majority of previous studies but which potentially affects the estimation of leaf angle distribution , was discussed .
#Text=As was shown by the presented results , using our approaches to estimate the leaf angle shows high potential .
#Text=A strong agreement in the relation and fewer potential errors between the LiDAR-derived and manual measurements were discovered .
#Text=High leaf curvature within the leaf classification region was considered to affect the accuracy of leaf angle estimation .

#Text=Fortunately , even if such a problem presents itself , our approach can flexibly change the extent of the size of the classification region based on an automatic adjustment of the k -value to achieve more accurate results .

#Text=It seems likely that depending on the range of the leaf classification region , the level of effect of leaf curvature on the leaf angle estimation is different , but there was not enough evidence to prove this here .
#Text=Thus , in future work , we would like to collect data from sampling trees with different curvatures to discuss them for achieving higher leaf angle estimation .

#Text=Furthermore , due to the location of the target tree , it is difficult to use data from more than one location of LiDAR surrounding the target tree to prevent effect of leaf occlusion on reconstruction of 3D model for LAD estimation .
#Text=To achieve more accurate results of LAD estimation , future improvements will also focus on field experimental design for data collection .
#Text=Looking at our study , automatic classification was achieved by specifying a different initial parameter ( L ) to find the k -value .
#Text=We considered that this approach is also possible for other issues related to unsupervised classification .
#Text=Besides , the LiDAR-derived leaf angle method may also be useful in retrieving another leaf structural parameter , such as the leaf area index ( LAI ) .
#Text=Aside from the remote sensing field , this method may also prove to be effective in the measurement of the leaf angle distribution in agriculture-relevant fields .
#Text=A method for accurate leaf inclination estimation in small plants has already been reported .
#Text=The estimation could lead to leaf area estimation and plant structural information monitoring .
#Text=In combination with our proposed method , we expect that more accurate leaf inclination angle estimation can be accomplished for leaf edges , even in small plants .
#Text=For these reasons , the presented method has the potential to contribute to various fields , including remote sensing and agriculture .
